context: I hate it when the waitress bring another table food when I got there first I cannot stand that!  Did this happen to you recently? Yeah, I'm so hungry usually and I'll get hangry when this happens

context: I'm scared a tornado will come in and destroy my city Tornadoes can be so terrifying. My house was swept up by one when I was a little kid. context: I am so mad at my sister in law. You just wait until I tell you what she's done! Oh my! What did she do? Well, my ex brother in law, her ex husband, gave her money to buy their son a car.  He's 17.  She took the money and went and got a chest enhancement instead!

context: My favorite restaurant closed down. I'd go so often after work I'm sorry to hear that. Maybe you can find a similar place around you! I'm waiting for this new place to open up. Feels like I've been waiting forever hahaha.

context: My prized, Argentinian goldfish died yesterday. I've never been so heartbroken. Oh no I am so sorry to hear that!  Thank you for the condolences, friend. He used to sing me such sweet lullabies when I was trying to fall asleep. I don't know how I will ever get any sleep at night now.
response: I can't imagine how much that much hurt. I hope you can at least cherish the memories you had together.

context: I was totally freaking out when I heard this crazy noise from the dumpster! I would have been running away. What did you do? I threw my trash into it as fast as I could and ran back to my car! I don't have any clue what was in there.

context: I stole some candy from the store. I felt so bad about it. Did this happen recently?  Did you take it back and admit the error? I don't know how I'll ever be able to sleep again.

context: So I was finally convinced to try rock climbing this weekend for the first time.  I do not like heights at all. Are you nervous about it? Hope it goes well. I am very scared I must admit.  I am sure it will be fine, but I would rather be on the ground.
response: Well maybe you should start with a small slope and work your way up. Don't terrify yourself.

context: I was walking down the street and I saw a really creepy clown smiling at me. I got so scared. Oh man.  Now I am having images of the movie "It" in my head.  What did you do? I just ran home and hid underneath my bed. I looked out the window and it was on the street still staring at me. Now I can't leave my house!
response: That is unusual behavior for a clown.  I would say you might want to call the authorities.  There has to be a law against a creepy clown stalker

context: My wife is off to her mom's. I will be alone and lonely without her Oh no! How boring. Could you call up a few buddies to hang out? Yeah , but the thought of not her being here makes me sad.
response: I can agree. Dont be too down. Im sure you can find someting to keep you busy.

context: My dog pooped on the rug today. I was livid! That's horrible. Were you able to get it up before it stained? I was, thankfully! I couldn't be mad at her for too long either. She is just a young pup after all.

context: I was livid when the pizza delivery guy showed up with only one of the pizzas we ordered for a party. That sucks. Did you tell him to go back and get the other one? Yeah, and he wasn't sorry about being over an hour late! We just cancelled the other part of the order.
response: I would've taken that pizza out of the box and smack him upside the head with it. What a lousy guy!

context: My dog pooped on the rug today. I was so mad! Oh no! Did your dog have to go really bad or what happened? She's a mere puppy, so she is learning. But she was doing such a good job going outside then all of a sudden she goes inside! I was not happy.

context: I let out a moist, hot, smelly, loud fart in front of all my co-workers today. I don't think I can ever show my face again. That's awful. I hope you can find a new job. context: You know what really grinds my gears??? What really grinds your gears, friend? Rotten potatoes? Beverly hillbillies? The new printer we got at work!!!!!!!!! It's so frustrating!!

I just wish times were just as simple as they seemed when I was younger.

context: SOMETIMES IT IS SAD TO SEE SOME POOR PEOPLE .. DO YOU AGREE I do agree. It seems like more and more people are going through rough times these days. Nobody wants to do anything about it. YES.. WORSE YET.. SOME ARE STRUGGLING TO MEET THEIR BASIC NEEDS..

We put him down to keep him out of pain.

context: I'm feeling a bit nervous today. I'm selling an appliance on Craigslist and I have someone coming over to look at it. Nervous about the person or nervous that they won't take it? Nervous about the person! It's always a risk having a stranger come to your home!

context: We just had a giant storm roll through this week. So much rain and lightning. The ground got so saturated that a tree fell down in my yard. Wow! context: Found some old pictures of my Dad fishing. I miss fishing with him. Wow, I've never done fishing,  so how is it like  I used to love going with Dad, but haven't really gone much since he passed.
response: It's well.  Please accept my condolence

context: I was diagnosed with a inguinal hernia yesterday. The amount of stress and anxiety is through the roof for me right now. Holy crap! Can it be remedied? Yes with surgery. This is going to require some time off from work which may be difficult.
response: I really hope it all works out for you. Work is important but your health is way more important!

context: I felt pity on my boyfriend last week,  but I wanted to leave him Oh yeah? Did you get it worked out? No,  he convinced me,  so I stayed.  But don't like his attitude
response: Have you considered couples therapy to try and work things out?

context: I bought a brand new jeep, and it's damaged already. I'm upset. Oh no,  that is not cool.  What happened?  Someone crashed into it in a parking lot. Didn't even leave a note.
response: That person is heartless though

context: Lately at night when I go to sleep I've been having sleep paralysis. It feels terrifying! Like someone is in the room with me. That's horrible. Have you any idea what might have caused it? I've watched some Youtube videos on it and it seems to be hereditary or sometimes sleep deprived. I guess I am usually sleep deprived!
response: You should go see a doctor about that. Sleep deprivation is very unhealthy

context: A few years ago, my employer of 13 years shut their doors and we all were laid off. I would probably have stayed at that place my entire career if it hadn't closed. That must have been devastating. Did it take you a long time to find a new position? No, I worked at another place for a year or so, but it was terrible, so I left there and am now going to school for something better. So, it all has worked out well.
response: I'm glad things have worked out in the end for you. Sometimes bad things happen for a reason.

context: My aunt died last year and I was thinking about her yesterday. That's very hard. I lost my uncle in january and it's so hard to think about. She was like a mom to be and raised me in my younger years. I'm so sorry.  Are you doing all right? I am, it's just that the fleeting memories make me sad.
response: They always do. It'll get easier to think about with time

context: I lost my mom's dog yesterday and it's been about 24 hours since she went missing! I'm trying to find her but had to take a break. So sorry about that,she will be found Thank you so much that means a lot. I've posted on a few dog watching apps and people are supportive.
response: You are most welcomed,just keep trying

context: My car keeps overheating and it's definitely not a good sign. I'm afraid I may have to find a new car soon. Do you know what kind of car you want to get? Possibly a truck this time. I've never had the pleasure of owning one.
response: What kind of things would you use the truck for?

context: everyone around me was pointing and laughing. I think I saw a couple of smartphones whip out and people taking pictures  What really happened? I slipped and fell at walmart. while wearing a skirt with no panties.
response: Oh,so sorry about that

context: I couldnt help myself esteem oh no. what happened? My shoe peeld off at the middle of the road,when i looked up,all eyes were on me
response: that is terrible! I know exactly how you feel

context: I went to Seattle once and it is such a pretty city.  But the rain, oh the rain.  I fell right in front of this cute guy. Did he try to help you up? I've always wanted to see Seattle! He didn't at all.  I felt so clumsy!  Seattle is nice, but don't go in March.
response: I'll remember not to go in March! I'm sorry you fell I hope you're not hurt!

context: I got so mad,  when my little sister spilled oil on my white trouser  Oh, that's rough. I bet that ruined them, didn't it? exactly,  and I was already late to work
response: Sounds like the start to a bad day.

context: These days I feel so isolated and alone. My daughter moved out so it's only me these days. That is a hard stage of life that I am not looking forward to! Do you get to talk to her often? Yes about once a week, sometimes more. She just went off to college so she lives out of state.
response: That is sad, but it is wonderful that you are able to

context: My grandmother is such a wonderful person and when I was 5 years old, she crocheted me the most beautiful pink and blue baby doll blanket.  Do you still have the blanket? That's an amazing gift from a wonderful part of your family. I do. I recently gave it to my own daughter for her to enjoy! It is so special.
response: I hope she cherishes it as much as you do! You're so awesome for doing that!

context: During a storm, a water main broke and flooded my entire house just a few weeks after my son was born. It destroyed a lot of our belongings and the house was ruined. I hope you're recovering well enough! That is absolutely devastating news to read. We have recovered finally. We ended up having to live in a hotel for a few weeks until we found a new place to live. Our family was very helpful.
response: That's great news! Did you have insurance?

context: I accidentally sent my boss an inappropriate text last night! I'm so mortified! Oh crap! That's not good! No, it's not! I meant to send it to my best friend. I don't know how I'm going to face him on Monday!
response: That may be kinda awkward.

context: My shorts fell down one time in gym class. Oh wow, that is super embarrassing. Did anyone take a picture? I don't think so, I tried to pull them up as fast as possible.
response: That's lucky.  You could have ended up on the Internet otherwise!

context: I work in a building that has parts of it under construction and our senior staff is offering tours. I'm a little worried about tripping and falling on something if I take a tour through the live construction zone.  I can certainly relate to you, it could be a safety hazard. I agree! I think if I do it, i need to buy some closed-toe shoes and make sure I'm wearing the correct clothing.
response: That's a smart move, that would reduce the risk of injury.

context: I have been feeling a little lonely lately  I'm sorry to hear that! Maybe you can find a local club so you can meet people with similar interests! That sounds like a great idea! I would love to just dance and shake off all these bad vibes! :)
response: That sounds like fun! And a great cure for loneliness!

context: When we were trying to buy our first home, our financing fell through. Oh no!  That had to be frustrating. I hope it wasn't too close to closing. It was a couple weeks out.  We had to switch lenders and it took another six months to find a place.
response: I hope you still found a great home! The home buying process is certainly frustrating.

context: I am very sad, my mother recently passed away from a heart attack Oh no. I'm so sorry. I totally understand how you feel. Mine passed away a few years ago, It's very difficult Yeah, I am very lucky to a have a great boyfriend, has has been very supportive and is helping me pull myself together.
response: It definitely helps to have a lot of support around you. Take care of yourself through this very difficult time.

context: Yesterday, I walked around with makeup smeared all over my face. I wish someone had told me. Oh my goodness! I did that after swimming one day. I was so busy getting the kids dressed that I forgot to clean my face. Black mascara all down my cheeks. Did anyone tell you? I completely forgot I even had it on until I got home.
response: No and I went to the grocery store and the library like that! No one said a word. It was so embarrassing.

context: Hey there, I had an embarrassing situation today.. Oh, I'm sorry to hear that! It can be tough when we feel that we have lost face in front of others. I was at the grocery store when I noticed my fly was undone!
response: Well, let's pretend that no one noticed! Either that, if someone noticed, perhaps they smiled when they thought "Wow, I've had that happen before, too"

context: It wasn't easy recently when I told a friend I needed to stay home from going out for food and some entertainment because it wasn't something I could afford. I am sorry to hear that. I hope your financial situation improves in the future. I do, too! Though, when you are caretaking for a parent, I realize it will be a very long time before that happens.
response: I believe that you will be in a better situation soon.

context: I was rather nervous the other night when I was waiting to sing at a concert. Oh wow! How did it go? Well people said they liked it, so I was glad, but I don't really think I sing that great. I'm sure you did great! I'd be a ball of nerves too, though. Thanks! It's not something I do very often so yeah, I was quite anxious about it.
response: Haha but you survied, Go you!

context: A few months ago I found some old family pictures. It made me miss old times Were they from when you were a kid? They were. It made me miss all my cousins and Aunts and Uncles who've passed.
response: I know what you mean. I sure miss my departed loved ones.

context: I'm so mad at my neighbor! He's working on his home and dropped nails in the street. Oh no! Does he do that a lot? Not really, but I was so annoyed when I came out this morning to a flat tire on my car.
response: I would be also. You should try to get him to fix your tire.

context: Last year my grandmother passed away. It's still hard to cope with Oh, I'm sorry to hear that. Losing a family member is so hard. It is. I still can't look at old pictures of her.
response: I miss my grandmother every day. I hope things get easier for you over time.

context: I went out for dinner the other night and it was at a really fancy restaurant.  I knocked my drink over by accident. Hey a similar thing happened to me! I hope no one saw! It was a full glass, and it spilled all over the table.
response: Ooops! I'm sorry to hear that. I'll tell you what though, it happens to the best of us! It's just a drink.

context: I was trying to get to a loaf of bread in the fridge, and I knocked over a full tub of my mother in law's chicken corn chowder! That must have been messy.  Were you able to get it all cleaned up? Yeah but now the kitchen smells like milky soup! My mother in law is going to be a little peeved too, oops.
response: I'm sure she's done something like that in the past herself though.

context: I just moved into a new place and I'm still waiting on a deposit from my old place. It's not looking good. Did you leave the old place damged Not at all. I was very diligent about cleaning everything up.
response: Then you should get it back

context: When I was pregnant, the smell of cooking egss made me feel so sick Really? Did you avoid eating them? I tried, but once I had to go to a brunch work thing for my husband's job.  I spent the whole time in the restroom.
response: Wow! That happened to me at work when I was pregnant, too. Except for me, it was curry.

context: I was so nervous to ride that roller coaster, but my sister was begging me to go. Oh, I know that feeling!  Did you end up going on the ride? I did, and it was scary! But I had a good time!
response: I'm glad it turned out so well!

context: I'm a teacher, one of my students was in a house fire. Is your student ok?? I am so sorry about that! No one got hurt.  But he lost his house and all of his belongings.  It was awful.
response: I hope they had insurance. It's one of the most horrifying things to experience that. I hope you are there for them.

context: I was watching an old VHS tape of my family and I out at the beach. It's crazy to think how time has flown by so fast. That must have brought back a lot of memories. It did. Life is good these days, but full of so many worries and stress. Sometimes I wish I could just go back to making dinky little sand castles.
response: I know, at least with my son I get to experience some of that still.

context: Don't you hate when you try and help someone with something and then you mess it up? I was trying to ease the burden of housework for my husband this weekend and it didn't go well. Oh no, what happened? I was trying to unclog our sink, got it all taken apart, and then was unable to put it back together again. I had to have him do it when he got home, so it wasn't much help in the end.
response: Were you at least able to get the clog out?  Hopefully your husband wasn't upset.

context: I've had this dirtbike since I was a kid, and took all kinds of care of it. My neighbor backed over it on accident. That must have been upsetting.  Were you able to get it fixed? It's completely mangled. I'm going to try myself, but it doesn't look good. So many years on that thing down the drain.
response: I'm so sorry to hear that.  You'll still have the memories at least.

context: When I was about seven years old, my cat Hector got out of the house and got lost in the neighborhood. Oh no! Were you able to find him ever?  Unfortunately we weren't. We put out signs but never were able to track him down.
response: Aw I'm sorry to hear that. Losing a pet is never an easy thing, especially when you don't know what happened to him.

context: A friend of mine just won  a lot of money off of a lottery ticket. Oh man that's amazing! How much was it? I hope they share. $10,000.  I feel happy for her, but still wish it had been me instead.
response: Yeah I'd be in your shoes thinking the same thing as well. That's almost heart stopping news to hear.

context: I watched a movie the other night with my kids, they really enjoyed it and we had a lot of cute conversation about it. What was the movie? I'm always looking for something new to watch with my kids! It's called Ponyo. They've been singing a song from it for the last couple of days.
response: I will have to check it out! Thanks for the suggestion.

context: I recently had to go interview for a job I knew I was under qualified for, so I was fairly nervous going in. I'd have been nervous too.  Did you find out if you got the job? The interview went pretty well, and I did end up getting the job, but I'm gonna have a lot of on the job training to do.
response: That's awesome.  I'm so happy for you.

context: My mom sent me a package the other day that had a bunch of my old comics in it the other day. It was a real trip to go through them all, it brought back a lot of memories. That sounds really great!  Do you like them as much as you remembered? A lot of them were still pretty good, but I think my fondness for them largely hinges on my memories of reading them as a kid.
response: haha, I felt the same when I read some of my old baby sitter's club books

context: My son's pediatrician told me to call Early Intervention because he's delayed in talking. Oh no, I'm sorry to hear that. Do they have any idea what the cause may be yet? Not at all.  I'm hoping he'll catch up soon.  The appointment is set for next week and I'm pretty nervous.
response: I hope it's nothing too serious. My younger brother had the same problem early on, but he turned out to just be a slow developer.

context: I found out that a friend of mine from high school passed away recently. I'm sorry to hear that, are you alright? Yeah, I'm doing okay. It hit pretty hard because we were pretty close back then, but had drifted apart the last few years. I wish I hadd taken the time to do more with him.
response: That's understandable, life goes so fast that it's easy to lose touch with people you care about. All I can do is try to limit that occurrence.

context: My daughter starts playing softball this year.  I tried playing when I was younger, but the other girls were mean I had a similar experience playiing little league baseball. How is your daughter feeling about it so far? She's extremely excited about it, but I can't help but be a little bit scared for her after my experience.
response: I feel you on that. I don't know if I could let my son play baseball after what I went through. I hope your daughter has a better experience.

context: When we were kids, my older sister pretended to abandon me at the mall because I was being a brat. Oh no, I had a older cousin who did that to me as well. Hopefully she was just giving you tough love or discipline. Yeah, I definitely deserved it LOL.  I never acted like that again with her!
response: Yeah it really teaches you! I would always sit down where i was and start crying.

context: I was walking to a restaurant to meet with some friends, and on my way there I tripped over a tree branch in front of a bunch of people and looked like a total idiot. When you tripped over the branch, did you get hurt? Only my pride, I fell right on my backside and made a ridiculous noise.
response: I hope you were able to laugh about falling and looking silly and not be too embarrassed?

context: I always think I want some "me" time, but this weekend my husband and our toddler son were both gone and I actually kind of felt bored and sad! Yeah it really isn't for everyone, i like my alone time but only for a while. Afterwards i feel alone and wanting to talk to someone. Exactly. We have an infant daughter, but she goes to bed so early that I had a lot of hours of doing nothing in particular.
response: Thats the perfect time to just pamper yourself. I cherish those few hours every day!

context: My mom made a cake for my brother's birthday so I can't touch it until he eats first. Sounds fair. How hungry are you right now? Pretty hungry, but the cake looks so good so I want even more. Strawberry shortcake style.
response: Haha I understand. It's like those cartoons where the smell is dragging someone through the air.

context: My grandmother passed away 20 years ago.  I just found a quilt she made me when I was a baby Wow what a find, cherish that quilt and keep it safe from harm! It has holes all in it, but I just can't let it go!  It means too much to me.
response: Yeah, and don't repair it! I think it gives it a history and makes it even more valuable.

context: I'm incredibly upset.  I just found out my husband has been cheating on me last week. Oh damn, that sucks. Have you guys talked or did you immediately cut him off? We talked long enough for me to tell him it's over.  We can't come back from this, no matter how difficult it will be for me.
response: Man thats terrible, I hope you can forget about him and find someone better.

context: My Ac went out a month ago. I knew it was gonna be during the summer. Were you able to get it fixed? Things break at the most inopportune times! Not yet, I'm working on it because it apparently has to be replaced. I did buy multiple floor fans though.
response: Well hopefully that is keeping you a little cool!

context: My husband and I renewed out wedding vows for our 25th anniversary. It was such a sweet and memory filled day.  Wow! Congratulations! That sounds like a wonderful thing to do. Was it just the two of you? Thank you. No, my grown children were there. They made a slide show of hubby and I over the years. Brought tears to my eyes.
response: Aw that is so sweet. That sounds like the most special day.

context: The first time I met my husband I made an absolute fool of myself. I drank way too much. Well, at least he knew what he was getting into right from the start lol. Haha! Very true, although I don't drink much at all now. He must have seen something he liked about me. I, on the other hand, felt horrible about it.
response: We all have those moments. I'm glad yours worked out so well.

context: I just found out I didn't get into the college I wanted to. I'm really disappointed and feel like I should give up Don't give up! You will find a better place and it will be the perfect fit. I'm trying to see that side of it, but it's the only school I wanted to go to
response: Everything happens for a reason. I think you will realize that and this could be a good thing is disguise.

context: I was at the store last week and slipped on some water on the floor I didn't see. I broke my leg! I was mortified!  Oh, no! That's awful! Are you still in pain? Yes, I will need to wear the cast for at least another 5 weeks. People are so rude too. They all just stood there and laughed at me!
response: I can't believe it! How could they? I'm so sorry to hear that...

context: I was walking around with my brother on a Sunday, and I got into a pointless argument with him. I am disappointed that I left myself get caught up in it. I think we all do that with our siblings. I'm sure he knows you still enjoy spending time with him anyway. Yes we talked it over and thought about all the good times we have when we get along!
response: I'm glad you were able to remedy the situation so easily! I think that shows you have a really good relationship with him.

context: I took my daughter to see a circus show at Circus Circus in Reno, and that look on her face was priceless. Oh I've been there! So much fun! I'd like to think that I had that same look when I went there at her age.
response: Did you guys play all the carnival games?

context: My one year old just learned how to take off her diaper and she smeared poop all over my leg the other day. Oh my god, I bet you were grossed out but laughing at the same time. It was so gross! She had been eating a chocolate granola bar so I thought it was just chocolate. It is funny now, but I was mortified then!
response: I really hope that is the last time it happens.

context: I found out the other day that I didn't get ther job I interviewed for. thats not good did you aplly for any other jobs? I did, I ended up getting another job I wanted, but I was pretty bummed about losing the other one. The commute would have been much nicer.
response: I see that is very understandle.

context: My dad gave my son a very special model car and within the week, it was broken. Oh no! I hope no one got in trouble!  He didn't understand, so he wasn't in trouble, but I have to admit I was a little sad about it.
response: I'd say so. That's so disheartening. I'm sure it was accidental.

context: My friend moved for a new job recently and she just took her two dogs to a shelter. She didn't even try to find them homes. Well that sucks. I hate it when animals are abandoned. I know, if she couldn't keep them, then at least she could try to find someone to take them in. So sad.
response: Yeah, that makes me sad too. I feel bad for them because they don't understand why she isn't with them anymore.

context: I recently got a promotion. It's quite a big step up from my current role, so I'm very nervous that I won't do well in it.  That is great news. I think you just might be nervous. They wouldn't have promoted you if you couldn't do it. I hope so, everyone tells me I'll do great, but I still have some reservations about it. It's way different than what I do now. I've not been sleeping well.
response: Well usually when you think the worst it turns out to be okay. I think you should try and relax.

context: A while back I moved from Chicago to Dallas, I was pretty sad to leave. It was my hometown! Big change! both big cities though right? I've always wanted to see that shiny bean thing in chicago.  Yes both are big cities! However Chicago feels less crowded honestly, the metroplex there is more spread out.
response: I hope you continue to adjust to your new surroundings, maybe you will end up loving Dallas, who knows!

context: A tree fell on my house, shattering my vinyl fence as my kids and I were walking passed it through the garage. Woah I hope no one was hurt No, but everyone was quite frightened.
response: I bet! Sounds like it would be a big shock

context: I was babysitting for someone I really didn't know. When they brought in the car seat, cockroaches crawled out of it. It was so gross!! Ew, that's really disturbing.  The sight of cockroaches always gives me the willies. Me, too! I felt like they were all over me! I can't imagine the house they live in...
response: Yes, I shudder to think of the condition of the rest of the home if the car seat is like that.

context: Woof I am having a hard time as of late. I've been waiting on an acceptance into a video production program and it's driving me up the wall. Oh, that must be nerve-wracking!  It is. A lot of self doubt has crept into my head as of late and I'm trying to fight it off. Patience isn't always a virtue that I am good with either. You should feel confident in your work! I am trying. Thanks for the boost!
response: Good luck!

context: My daughter picked a new flavor of ice cream and my friend and I ate it before she even got a bite. Uh oh. Do you think she will be mad when she finds out? I felt so bad that I made my husband go buy her more before she found out!
response: Oh she will be none the wiser. But don't feel bad sometimes you have to indulge, and I would figure you still left her some.

context: I've been training my cats to use the toilet. At first they were and everyone was super impressed, but now they've forsaken the toilet AND litter box entirely. Wow! So have you tried any methods to get them back on track? Someone might have advice on Youtube. I've been consulting the old youtube for sure, but I think these guys are just rebelling.
response: Ah! Sounds like you need a "Cat Whisperer"!

context: Recently, my dog died. It was so heartbreaking. We had him since 2010. Oh no that would make him quite young. I'm so sorry! Do you have plans for another one when you're ready?  He was a loving dog. Probably! I would love to get a Labrador Retriever.
response: Those are awesome dogs, I've known quite a few in my life. Well whenever you're ready I think it'll be a perfect match.

context: My husband had a job interview a few days ago...now we are waiting... Ahh that's so anxiety-making. I hope he gets the jon. Me, too! The anticipation is killing me!!!
response: Fingers crossed!

context: I was only asleep for an hour last night and I jumped out of bed! There was this smacking noise on my window it freaked me out! Yikes! did you figure out what it was? You'll never guess haha! It was just a twig. The age old branch slapping on the window in the wind.
response: It must have been awfully windy.

context: I was home by myself when the power went out and I heard a strange noise! Oh, that sounds scary! Did you find out what it was? No. I was too scared to look so I looked myself in my bedroom.
response: Well it was probably nothing to worry about because you seem alright now. :)

context: I had to give a speech to over 300 people in front of my church. Wow, that's a lot of people. I was so nervous! I get very shy around crowds!
response: I know the feeling. I get sick around crowds.

context: I went for a run the other day and a dog chased me while I was pushing my baby in the stroller! I would have been so scared!  I don't understand having dogs off leash. It was terrifying! I was so mad. The owner was nowhere to be found.
response: So reckless!  It's really not that hard to leash dogs.  And with the baby there too, ugh.  I can't imagine.

context: My nephew was racing around our house, like he has a million times before, and someone took a bad fall into the corner of a bookcase.  I had to take him to the ER. Ouch! Kids have a tendency to learn things the hard way. Was he okay? Yes, luckily it looked much worse than it actually was!
response: That's good! My son is always running into stuff! He needs bubblewrap to keep him safe.

context: My son went off to college. I found a baby picture of him and it made me sad. I'm sorry. They grow up fast. Its hard to watch them leave the nest. I guess I need to find a hobby to keep me busy!
response: That can help. I know I like my hobbies lol.

context: I had an interview and I forgot a portion of what I was saying. It was a little awkward. Oh no ! Were you able to come up with something else to say ? Yes! I think I recovered okay. I just moved on to my next statement. It's a bummer freezing up though!
response: I understand, but I bet you did well in spite of that !

context: I had to ask my teacher if she would mind going over a assinment again with mme Wow! That must have taken a lot of guts, but I hope it was worthwhile. Yeah it was good for me but i was nervous to ask
response: Oh no, why were you so scared?

context: One time when I was in middle school, my friend was making fun of me. So, I pulled his pants down. Oh my! Well, I bet he quit making fun of you in light of his own embarrassment. Actually, he stopped making fun of me because he was an alien.
response: An alien? Wow.

context: When I moved to a new town, it was hard to make new friends? That sounds difficult. Did you try talking to people in your neighborhood? Yes, they are all old.
response: That always sucks. But old people are great and sometimes funny to hang out with. Maybe you should try giving them a go!

context: My brothers wife left him and took off with the baby. Oh wow! That really sounds like your brother is going through a rough time. He is. Its hard on all of us.
response: I hope everything works out, family is everything.

context: My high school friend hit my car. Ah, that is terrible! I guess it was their fault? What did you do? Yes it was 100% her fault. They hit my car that she let me park in her driveway! She should have been more careful.
response: Wow, hopefully you both have insurance.

context: Today I visited a campus where I used to work, it was good to be there and I kind of missed the old times! Ahh, do you still have friends there? Yes Maybe you can visit them more often because you like it there so much. Yes, I could, but it's not quite the same when you don't actually work there any more.
response: Yeah, I guess. take care my friend.

context: Someone pulled out in front of me and hit my car! Oh no that's terrible! Are you okay? Yes, I was coming around a curve and they just pulled out. My car is totaled though.
response: I'm glad you weren't injured, but it really sucks that your car is totaled. I hope you have a reliable mode of transportation!

context: So i was out last night running and i felt my pants ripe Oh no! Were you close to home? yeah but still i had to cover myself
response: At least you had something to cover yourself with!

context: I was at a relatives funeral and during a rendition of Amazing Grace, I accidentally passed gas very loudly. im sorry to hear that. did everyone know you did it? Definitely. It was awful.
response: well you cant help it and it happens sometimes

context: My first baby just turned 11 yesterday. I can't believe she is a pre-teen now. I feel like she was just a baby not too long ago. They grow up so fast! Have you noticed differences in her personality now that she's getting older? Yes! She cares about her appearence more than ever and wants to shave her legs. She also has more of an attitude. Sometmes it's intentional and sometimes its not.
response: Its a hard age for girls as I'm sure you remember. At least she has a good mom to guide her!

context: I am thinking of getting this polaris slingshot I have been wanting. Hence the Mturking. I'm not sure if I will be able to afford it though Oh yes you can. Just keep turking and you will get there for sure even if you have to work extra hours in the night. maybe I could get the 2035 year model haha I promise it is possible if you really want it. Show me how bad you want it!! That's true! I wish I could find something else that pays better.
response: You can manifest anything your heart desires.
